intro: Stachys ocymastrum f. bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored wood betony, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces spikes of small, two-toned flowers—typically pink and white. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands or along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
